snippet: The agency rejected requests from several states to relax the ethanol mandate because of a sharp decline in the corn crop.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency rejects requests from states to relax its requirement on the use of corn ethanol in gasoline related to a steep decline in the nation's corn production.
lead_paragraph: The agency rejected requests from several states to relax the ethanol mandate because of a sharp decline in the corn crop.

headline.seo: E.P.A. Upholds Ethanol Standard on Use in Gasoline
headline.main: E.P.A. Upholds Federal Mandate for Ethanol in Gasoline
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Upholds Federal Mandate for Ethanol in Gasoline
